reporting-org.narrative: International Network for Bamboo and Rattan(INBAR)

title.narrative: Dutch-Sino East Africa Bamboo Development Programme

description.narrative: Enhancing Climate Change Mitigation and Adaptation benefits by developing inclusive and sustainable industrial and SME bamboo value chains resulting in enhanced livelihood opportunities, food security, and environment management in East Africa

participating-org.narrative: International Center for Bamboo and Rattan
Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change

activity-date.narrative: Program team grounded; Bamboo Site-species matching study initiated with national level reputed environment & Forests Research Institutes; Gender Study on Bamboo in final stage; Baseline survey in the final stage; Bamboo seeds procured from China and India for large scale planting materials production; Capacity building training initiated on bamboo furniture, clean energy, bamboo housing, sustainable bamboo harvesting and management, resource mapping, strengthen bamboo association for encouraging private investors; twenty-two (22-Ethiopia-6; Kenya-7 and Uganda-22) bamboo economic clusters identified diagnostic study report for the clusters in progress. Awareness and sensitization activities in progress i.e. celebrate World Bamboo Day, discussion in progress with TVET for bamboo curriculum, discussion in the pipeline with FSC Global Development GmbH for Forest Stewardship Council(FSC )for 1000 hectare in Ethiopia. An initiative in progress with the Private Bamboo Industry in Ethiopia based on the final report on bamboo-composite research, Wageningen Research, The Netherlands. Discussion and joint action plan developed with SNV in Ethiopia for collaboration in clean energy and entrepreneurship development. Due to CoVID19 pandemic and Government restrictions are challenges to speed-up the planned activities.

organisation.narrative: International Network for Bamboo and Rattan

mailing-address.narrative: East Africa Regional Office of INBAR, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

recipient-country.narrative: Ethiopia is the largest bamboo growing country in Africa and having ample opportunity for SME and industrial value chain promotion for poverty reduction and environmental management. The country is having robust Bamboo Development Strategy and Action Plan 2019-30
Kenya is having bamboo resource and focusing for SME and industrial value chain promotion for poverty reduction and environmental management.

Uganda has an estimated 54,533 ha of bamboo growing area. The utilization of resources is mostly confined to meet the sustenance needs, traditional low value product. The country is having National Bamboo Strategy and Action Plan 2019-30
